content:
Diagnosis:	Locally extensive right breast carcinoma with infiltration of axillary nodes

Histology:	Grade III invasive ductal carcinoma
	Estrogen receptor low positive (3/8), HER2 negative
	Ultrasound-guided biopsy confirmed metastatic involvement of right axillary nodes

Trial participation:	Enrolled in BEACON-3 trial January 2024

Treatment delivered:	Completed per-protocol 4 cycles epirubicin/cyclophosphamide followed by 4 cycles docetaxel with marked clinical response

Surgical intervention:	Right mastectomy with axillary lymph node dissection and immediate TRAM flap reconstruction August 2024. Post-operative course complicated by partial flap necrosis requiring debridement

Adjuvant therapy:	Completed chest wall radiotherapy 40Gy in 15 fractions November 2024

Past medical history:	Autoimmune hypothyroidism
	Chronic kidney disease stage 3A
	Recurrent depression on maintenance SSRI

Current situation:	Recently diagnosed cerebellar metastases on MRI February 2025

I reviewed [redacted name] today following the recent MRI brain which has unfortunately demonstrated two cerebellar metastatic lesions, the dominant lesion measuring 3.1cm in the right cerebellar hemisphere with surrounding edema and early compression of the fourth ventricle. She reports progressive unsteadiness over the last 4 weeks, with increasing difficulty managing stairs and tendency to veer to the right when walking. She has also developed intermittent nausea and diplopia. She commenced on Dexamethasone 8mg daily three days ago with mild improvement in symptoms.?

After thorough discussion of management options, we have agreed to proceed with stereotactic radiosurgery to both lesions, scheduled for next week. I have provided detailed guidance regarding dexamethasone dosing with a 6-week tapering schedule, emphasizing the need for immediate medical review if any worsening of cerebellar symptoms occurs, as dose escalation may be necessary.?

She has opted to postpone her daughter's wedding in Australia planned for next month. I have made an urgent referral to our neurological rehabilitation team and palliative care service for comprehensive support.?
